item.description:
TAG! The Card Game is a fast and furious card version of real-life tag. Where the goal of the game is not to get tagged.

Each player needs to get rid of the "IT!" card as soon as possible or when the "TIME" card shows up...you lose!

TAG! The Card Gam is a non-linear card game that resembles the game UNO and Hot Potato. Speed is essential, to win you have to play fast or smart!

How to play: 

 The game starts with all players picking up (4) cards and picking a player to be "IT!"
 The player who is "IT!" starts by placing a card from their hand onto the discard pile passing the "IT!" card to another player, making them the new "IT!"
 Keep passing the "IT!" card until the "TIME" card shows up. Immediately place the "TIME" card down, whoever is "IT" at that moment loses! 




—description from the publisher

Fates of Madness is rules-lite cooperative card game with challenging playability. This horror themed adventure is based on the Gothic Campaign Compendium project and is the first joint project between Legendary Games and Mythica Gaming.

This diceless game is varied by the use of Fate cards and skill level to determine success or failure.

You'll find seven scenarios and six monsters that four adventures will have to succeed using skill checks, combat, and spells. Fate cards and madness can have surprising outcomes. Will any of the players survive or will the game end in a total party kill?

Dozens of equipment, potions, and treasure cards allow the adventurers to prepare for the ultimate battle with the boss monster!

A selection of sinister boss monsters awaits the party in an ever-harrowing destiny!

—description from the publishers

The Tyrant must be eliminated! In Matem o Rei, you must kill the King by moving your assassin among the guests of the masquerade. Using poisons, daggers, and bombs, you need to be the first to depose the Despot. But beware, the other players may stop you by changing the direction of the dance!

Matem o Rei contains 48 cards, 17 masks and a board. During their turns, the players can use their cards to move the guests of the same color and same mask around the board, making a way to the King or hindering other players. Knowing which cards to keep, which to use and which to discard can be the difference in the victory. Players can also attempt to murder the King. But beware! Each player also has a bribed Guard, which can protect the King.

Players don't know each others identity, neither of the Guards. Use this to your advantage, moving your assassin in secret until the right time. You can also change your mask or weapon better suit your strategy.

The first player to assassinate the King wins the game.

キズナと螢の物語 (Story of KIZUNA and "Luciola cruciata")

item.description:
In We the Meeples, three to five players will pick and argue about the laws that are to implemented in the newly formed country of Boardgamelandia. Each player will have a political alliance with one of nine political parties and try to score points based on the laws the players pass throughout the game. The player at the end of the game with the strongest political party becomes the first President of the country.

After dealing out cards, players will draw another card on their turn, choose between the two cards for what laws they want to pass, and arguing will commence. The twist for Boardgamelandia's new Constitution though states that every bill must pass. It is up to the players to determine which part of the bill will go through through every political means possible

In this tiny 18 card game, players will constantly have to defend their political beliefs in 18 different categories on cards that are usable in four different ways. But, if you see the laws are not going your way, you may decide to change political parties mid way through the game. Will you represent The Mind of the Republic with dignity, will you argue for the Agricolarians and their ways of life, or are you a member of the Secret Fascists and plotting world domination.

-description from designer

The deck features classic UNO game play, plus some special Legend of Zelda touches. Includes special Triforce Wild Cards that when played require the next player to follow with a card that has a Triforce on it. If they they can't they need to draw three cards.

item.description:
Pirate Rumble is a multiplayer party game with two modes- "Duo mode" and "Camp mode". Players playing the role of legendary pirates from all over the world pass through time and space to Arizona, United States in the late 19th century, competing for the mysterious treasure “Lost of Dutch”. Each pirate must compete with other pirates for the treasure even if they might sacrifice their life.

GAME PLAY

On each turn, all players play 1 card from their hand simultaneously. Then, everyone reveal it at the same time and immediately do the gesture on the card. After that, Count the effect of cards played on this turn.

There are 6 basic cards in the deck of each pirate. You can play "Load" to collect bullets; "Shoot", "Shoot Twice" and "Fire" to deal damage; “Dodge" to defend the damage; "Search" to find special cards which are more powerful than basic cards.

Everyone has to eliminate other pirates until one player survives alone. If only one player (one camp) survives, then the player(the camp) is the winner.

A True Scotsman! is a small card game that combines deduction with clever card-play that aims to create a fun and engaging gaming experience for two players in 5-15 minutes.

Throughout the game players must expose the Traitor in their enemy's ranks. As insults fly from either side of the battlefield, certain members of each clan are compelled to lift their kilts in contempt! However, will this act of defiance reveal a true Scotsman or uncover an Englishman - and the spy amidst their ranks...?

On their turn, players will play cards representing the troops and events on the battlefield, trying to expose the Traitor hidden in their enemy's ranks. However, other events represent the Traitor's ability to remain hidden – but as soon as his luck runs out, he is exposed as an Englishman and his clan’s claim to the throne is lost. This player’s opponent wins the game.

-description from designer

item.description:
Welcome to the Peanut Club!

As a famous collector you're invited to a tremendous auction sale wich take place at the cross of disparate universes.
Your goal is to leave the auction sale with the most beautiful collection of objects.

 How does it works?

Peanut Club is a game based on a twisted bidding mechanism. 
To bid you have the choice between three currencies: Camels, Peanuts, and Million Dollars. The rate of each currency is randomly fixed but it may vary during the game.

At the beginning of the game, each player will choose a character card with their category symbol and will receive a random set of currency cards for a value of 35. Then, a first collection of 1 to 3 object cards to be sell is revealed and players begin to bid at the same time. Each object card shows the object itself and two category symbols from eight existing.

The higher bid will win the collection as usual, but the players can use some powers during the bid. For example, they can change the rate of a currency, forbid to use a currency to buy a collection, or use the currencies they want to pay a bid. Of course those powers are one shot! Well, almost.

After the winner of the first collection has paid their bid, they put the collection in face up in front of them and then the next collection is revealed.

 How does it ends?

As long as there is still something to bid for and someone has currency cards in their hand, the auction sale continues. However when the auction sale is over the players count their victory points.

For every 3 identical category symbols it's 3 points, for every Luxury, Antique and player's character category symbol it's 1 point, everything is cumulative. The one with the most victory points win the game.

•••

 Bienvenue au Peanut Club !

En tant qu’illustres collectionneurs, vous êtes invités à une prestigieuse vente aux enchères se déroulant à la croisée d’univers hétéroclites. 
Votre but, repartir de la vente avec le plus bel assortiment d’objets.

 Comment ça marche?

Peanut Club est un jeu basé sur une mécanique d'enchère biaisée...
Pour enchérir, trois monnaies sont acceptées : les Millions de dollars, les Chameaux et les Cacahuètes. La valeur de chaque monnaie est fixée aléatoirement au début de la partie et pourra évoluer au cours de la partie.

Au début de la partie, chaque jour reçoit une carte Personnage avec sa catégorie préférentielle et reçoit aléatoirement des cartes Monnaie pour un total de 35 en valeur. Ensuite, un lot de 1 à 3 cartes Objet est révélé et les joueurs peuvent alors commencer à enchérir simultanément. On peut trouver sur chaque carte Objet l'Objet en question et les deux symboles des catégories auquel il appartient (parmi les 8 catégories existantes).

Le plus haut enchérisseur remportera le lot comme traditionnellement, mais les joueurs auront quelques pouvoirs à leur disposition pour influencer la phase d'enchères. Ils pourront, par exemple, modifié la valeur respective des Monnaies, interdire l'utilisation d'une Monnaie, ou encore utiliser n'importe qu'elle Monnaie pour payer l'enchère remportée. Bien entendu ces pouvoirs sont limités à une seule utilisation... Enfin presque!

Après que le meilleur enchérisseur a payé son offre, il place le lot d'Objets devant lui et un nouveau lot d'Objets est mis aux enchères.

Quand le jeu se termine-t-il ?

Tant qu'il y a des Objets sur lesquels enchérir et au moins un joueur à qui il reste de la monnaie, les enchères continuent. Lorsque la vente est terminée, les joueurs vont compter leurs points de victoire.

Chaque série de 3 symboles de catégorie identiques rapporte 3 points. Chaque symbole Luxure, Antique, et chaque symbole du type de votre personnage rapporte 1 point supplémentaire. Tout est cumulatif. Le joueur avec le plus de points de victoire remporte la partie!

item.description:
DoodleMash is a really fun party game for any occasion. What do you get when you cross a giraffe, praying mantis, and a penguin? A Manffeguin? How about when you cross a baboon with a bee and a spider? A Beeboonder? An eagle, snail, bear? Lion, moose, bird? You get DoodleMash! The combinations are endless with this one of a kind game that matches imagination with doodling to create some of the funniest, wildest creatures you could ever dream of! From art rooms to living room, or boardrooms to board game pubs. Doodlemash doesn't disappoint.

Each round every player will draw a token that has 3 random numbers on it. The numbers will correspond to animal cards dealt on the board. The players will then have 60 seconds (or less) to mash up the 3 animals into 1. After the timer is up, players exchange drawings and try to guess which numbers the other player has based on the drawing. Landing on an "X" on the board will draw a sketchy card which changes how the other players must draw. From non-dominant hand to blind draw, sketchy cards always draw a laugh.

First one across the finish wins.

-description from publisher

from the back of the box: "The Ultimate Playbook of Puzzlers. Whether you're a serious football fan or a casual Sunday warrior, Ball Busters will challenge and amuse the competitor in you with brainteasers and curious questions featuring football stats and stars of yesteryear and today.

Test your knowledge of football with your family and friends and see how much you really know when it comes to football then and now.

Score a touchdown every time you play."

This is a trivia card game with a football theme. The deck of question cards is passed around the table with each player answering a question until there is an incorrect response. The deck then moves to the right with another player attempting to provide the answers. The first contestant to get three correct answers in a row is declared the winner.

ArenaBots is a tactical combat game for 2 to 6 players. You play a young pilot of bots who faces his opponents for glory in a LAB in the rich universe of Eden. You will have to control your bots, make them fight, move and hack the enemy bots in order to emerge victorious from the fight.

The game is played out as a succession of rounds during which the active player can play "routines" cards and / or activate his driver.

The "routines" cards are one of the original points of the game. They represent both the possibilities of actions of your bots and the defense programs of your pilot. If you want to activate your bots it will be necessary to play a card and to realize the action described on this one. If your pilot takes damage, you will need to discard a card.

The different bots you have under your control have special abilities. It's up to you to use them wisely to dominate your opponents in the arena.

The RoninBot has advanced combat software, Jujitsu 2.0, which allows it to attack multiple opponents at once.

The PushBot can move other Bots thanks to its Tesla pistons, but their programming prevents them from pushing a Pilot.

The SipderBot is equipped with an electromagnetic web allowing it to hack remotely.

The combat and hacking actions are resolved by a die roll. 
A bot that suffers a success to a combat roll is destroyed and removed from the arena. A pilot who suffers a success to a combat roll must discard a "routine" card.

A bot or terminal changes sides when hacked. The successful hacker places a possession marker of his color on the base of the hacked bot or terminal.

At the end of his turn, the active player draws 2 "routine" cards. When a player finishes his deck of "routine" cards the game ends.

In order to determine the winner, players score points in the game and at the end of the game.

Each terminal under your possession at the beginning of your turn grants you a victory point. Each bot under your possession, at the end of the game, grants you a victory point.

At the end of his turn, the active player draws 2 "routine" cards. When a player finishes his deck of "routine" cards the game ends.

In order to determine the winner, players score points in the game and at the end of the game.

Each terminal under your possession at the beginning of your turn grants you a victory point. Each bot under your possession, at the end of the game, grants you a victory point.

The player with the highest number of victory points wins the game. Congratulation to him but the glory is short-lived because soon another fight will take place!

—description from the publisher

item.description: The players travel with their steamboats on the Elbe from Mühlberg to Leitmeritz. Movement is determined by a die. The first player to reach space 40 wins the game.

name.value: #POTUS: Battle Inside the Trump White House

item.description:
#POTUS: Battle Inside the Trump White House is the working title of a satirical political game that simulates the fighting between the rival factions inside President Donald J. Trump’s White House throughout his first 12 months in office.

Each player represents one of four factions (Establishment GOP, Nativist Nationalists, Globalist Plutocrats, or Moderates/Military Leadership) struggling to control the President's Twitter feed and advance its Hidden Agenda of secret scoring cards drafted before the game begins.

#POTUS is easy to play. The game combines a classic trick-taking mechanic with the CDG system familiar to players of Twilight Struggle or Churchill.

Each trick, you'll play two cards to win Trump Tweet scoring cards, vote on legislation before Congress, or capture powerful "Ace" cards representing individuals with special abilities, like Bob Mueller, John McCain or Vladimir Putin. The cards in your hand represent individuals like Ivanka Trump, Steve Bannon, Jeff Sessions, Anthony Scaramucci and so on.

Each card is rated for its Juice (political power -- think Ops Points in a card-driven game) and Squeeze (an event that can be triggered). By winning Tweets, passing legislation, scoring big business deals and fulfilling your Hidden Agenda cards, you earn Victory Points. The faction with the most VPs at the end of the game wins.

-description from designer

High Rise is a strategic city-building game with a bit of corruption. You can get bonuses on your actions by gaining Corruption, but the game will periodically penalize the most corrupt players, and everyone loses VP for Corruption at the end of the game.

You'll perform all your actions — like collecting resources, constructing buildings, and repaying favors — on a one-way track. Like other one-way track games, you can go as far as you'd like, but you'll only get another turn when everyone else passes you. You gain 1 VP per floor for each building you construct. Tenants offer powerful actions that change each game. You can collect a tenant power by landing on its space or constructing a building on its card.

The round ends after everyone makes a lap around the one-way track. Players score bonus points for tallest buildings in each neighborhood and the game. You'll play 2 rounds in the Standard Game (about 90-120 minutes for 3-4 players) and 3 rounds (about 2.5 hours) in the Full game. After the appropriate number of rounds, players lose points for Corruption, and the player with most VP wins.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
It is the Age of Rebirth, thanks to the discovery of a new type of catalytic energy and the special individuals who are able to exploit it. These rare individuals, known as “Catalyst”, use this energy to act together in a sort of interconnected network. Can you make the most of their superhuman abilities to lead your city to fame and fortune?

This is a simple yet deep game of engine-building and powerful combos. You will carefully build up your chain of actions, and then finally pull the trigger to perform all them at the same time!

At the beginning of the game, a random Goal card is revealed. This will set various ways to score extra victory points at the end of the game, thus deeply affecting the available strategies.
 The game is turn-based and on your turn you must choose to perform one action among the following three:

-Take a number of coins equal to the highest cost visible on the Catalyst cards displayed on the board.

-Pay the indicated number of coins to recruit one of the available Catalyst cards on the board. The cost is altered by the current position of the card on the board. Once recruited, you can put the Catalyst card in one of the buildings you have managed to build.

-Activate one of your recruited Catalyst cards to perform its effect. These will provide you several bonuses and actions like gaining extra coins, building new buildings, recruiting other catalyst cards from the board, obtaining military power tokens which will score for majorities at the end of the game, or allowing you to immediately activate other Catalyst cards. Whenever you activate a Catalyst card which is located in one of your buildings, the building provides an additional effect.

Activated Catalyst cards go into your scoring pile, while buildings always remain in front of you.

Buildings are also extremely important due to the fact each additional scoring indicated on the Goal card is related to a specific building; this means that you can score for it only if you first have managed to build that building.

When the deck runs out of cards, there is a final round and then the game ends: players score points according to the Goal card as well as for the majority of Military power tokens and activated Catalyst cards. Whoever gathered the most victory points is the winner.

-description from publisher

item.description:
Nothing is better than freshly baked cookies! As soon as the stove opens, Pummeleinhorn and his friends are ready to eat them up. With a heavy heart, though, they put a few cookies in the jar to save them for bad times — but did they really release the cookies from their paws?

Pummeleinhorn: Mampf Mampf plays like Mau Mau in that players try to empty their hand of cards by taking turns playing cards onto a discard pile, matching the top card's color or number when doing so.

The game contains a few special cards that mix up gameplay. Each time someone plays a biscuit tin, a card from the deck is placed in the separate biscuit pile, and whenever a biscuit card is played, all of the cards on the biscuit pile are dealt out among the players. The Pummelfee card allows a player to hand cards to another player, but only if luck smiles on them in the right conditions.

Caïssa is one of the "Atlantis Triplets" that employs different implementations of the "atlantis effect," the gradual disappearance of the playing area, eventually leaving one king or the other without refuge.

The other two are Shakti and Cyclix.

On top of that, Caïssa introduces another absolute novelty: "capture by exchange," which is in fact no capture at all.

Cyclix is one of the "Atlantis Triplets" that employ different implementations of the "atlantis effect", the gradual disappearance of the playing area, eventually leaving one king or the other without refuge.

The other two are Shakti and Caïssa.

A captured piece is removed from the board and returned to the owner, who is then said to have the piece "in hand." A piece in hand may conditionally be re-entered. This is done by moving the king and placing the piece on the tile thus vacated.

It's lemonade season and you run a successful lemonade stand. Unfortunately, today you're not the only lemonade stand on the block. To settle this problem, you and your rivals agree to a lemonade drinking contest. But wait, something's wrong! Little Johnny, the neighborhood menace, is up to no good. During this contest you might take a gulp of something ... THAT'S NOT LEMONADE!

That's Not Lemonade is the simplest press-your-luck game there is. On your turn, decide if you will take a card or pass. If you get a That's Not Lemonade card, you're out for the round. The player with the most lemon cards at the end of the round wins a lemon card. First player to win 3 lemons wins.

Comes with 18 cards, 6 player tiles, and 6 mini cups.

It's the drinking game for kids!

Sokhazania is a unique game of chance for the whole family, designed to simulate a football match in 15 minutes of game time. It is easy to learn the rules and start having fun immediately.

Sokhazania works on the rule that you will always lose the ball when rolling a 1 or 2, and you will always be able to pass the ball to one of your players or take a shot at goal. If the dice lands out of the box you lose the ball to the other player for a throw-in.

Shots at goal must be defended by the goalie by rolling the dice. If the goalie rolls a 1 or 2 the ball is lost to a corner and the attacking player gets a chance to strike again. If the goalie rolls a 3 or 4 the goal is scored and the game restarts from the centre. A save is made the goalie throws a 5 or 6 and the game restarts from the Goalie Dot.

The player who scored the most goals in 15 minutes is the winner. Extra-time can be played on a draw or the game can be decided with a Penalty Shoot-out.

On a distant island, geese live in different villages. One day, they decide to cross the river and go on an adventure to the mysterious world. As only six boats can be used, each villages tries hard to let more of their geese embark. Meanwhile, the naughty wildcats and weasels are to hinder everyone...

Game Set Up: Place the boat card and black dice in the center of the playing area; Each player chooses a color and takes their respective game cards, dice, and player screen of their own colors; Each player places the player screen in front of them.

Game Play: There will be 6 turns in a game.
1. Each player rolls a dice and places it on the boat card. The summation of the number on dice represent the number of boat seats in this round;

2. Each player chooses 2 cards in their hands, then places the card face-down in front of themselves in same time. When all players are ready, everyone reveals their chosen cards by turning them face-up;

3. Executing the action of the function cards.

4. According to the number printed at upper-right corner of the cards, arrange the goose cards and luggage cards in ascending order near the boat card. The smallest number of card can embark first, followed by the others accordingly until the boat full loaded;

5. Each players moves their goose card (which get onto the boat) and AC-Goose Man Card (which successfully got rid of the weasels) to their own scoring zone, trashes the remaining goose cards and used function cards to the trash pile;

6.Start the next turn.

Game End: When you have played 6 turns, the game is over. Each player calculates their adventure points; each goose in the scoring zone valued 1 adventure point and each AC-Goose Man in the scoring zone valued 3 adventure points.

The Winner: The player with the most adventure points is the winner. If two or more players tie, the winner will be the player with the most AC-Goose Man cards.

name.value: Hearts of Iron: The Board Game

item.description:
Hearts of Iron: The Board Game is a game of grand strategy warfare, tactical battles, and shrewd diplomatic choices based on the popular Hearts of Iron video game franchise released on PC by Paradox Interactive. The board game takes place during the WWII era, and with the expansions, allows for players to battle for territories across the world. Get ready to change the course of history and forge your nation's path to victory and glory!

This is the core base game and features the Eastern European war theater.

—description from the publisher

name.value: くだものフレンズ (Fruit Friends)

item.description:
Air Strike is a simple and fun air combat game for the whole family, that requires only a regular deck of playing cards and a tape-measure or ruler.

Take to the skies in modern jets of all types, launching missiles and trying to evade them!

Suitable for 2 - 10 players. Games last from 5 - 10 minutes.

Air Strike has a basic section with the basics of movement and missiles, then has an optional extra section which adds cannon attacks, ground attack aircraft, electronic warfare aircraft, and SAM sites. There are multiple missions tailored to 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6 players, although 7 or more can be easily gamed using a simple points system.

Printable markers are provided so you can print out aircraft and missiles, or you can use toy aircraft or miniatures.

—description from the publisher

"Frontier War" ("Guerra Fronteriza" in spanish) allows you to take control of one of the four most relevant factions in World War 2.
Chose which role you want to take in the fray: United States, United Kingdom, Germany or Russia in games for 2 to 4 players. 
Recreate battles of the largest military clash in history.
Learn how to manage your resources, make bold tactical movements with your troops: infantry, tanks, artillery and airstrikes. 
Make alliances that meet your interests, but remember, your allies can stop being so at any time! 
Fight Smart and never cease exploring your options, since the end of the battle can arrive at the most unexpected moment. 
The game includes 100 fully detailed miniatures, a modular battle field for new and different games each play, as well as 90 cards that will make each game unique.
We’ve worked hard to give the game easy mechanics and a quick learning without losing a high tactical complexity, all of it within the frame of fast, dynamic games. 
Are you ready?
—description from the publisher (Translated)

"Guerra Fronteriza" te permite tomar el control de una de las cuatro facciones más relevantes de la Segunda Guerra Mundial. 
Decide qué papel quieres tomar: Estados Unidos, Inglaterra, Alemania o Rusia en partidas de 2 a 4 jugadores. 
Recrea múltiples batallas de la mayor contienda bélica de la historia. 
Aprende a administrar tus recursos, realiza audaces movimientos tácticos con tus tropas: infantería, tanques, artillería y ataques aéreos. 
Crea alianzas según tus intereses, pero recuerda, en cualquier momento tus aliados pueden dejar de serlo. 
Combate inteligentemente y no dejes de investigar, pues el final de la batalla puede ocurrir en el momento más inesperado. 
El juego cuenta con 100 miniaturas con todo detalle, un campo de batalla modular para crear partidas nuevas y diferentes, además de 90 cartas que harán que cada partida sea única.
Se ha buscado dotar al juego de una mecánica sencilla, un aprendizaje ágil y una complejidad táctica alta, todo ello dentro de un marco de partidas rápidas y dinámicas de corta duración. 
¿Estás preparado?
—description from the publisher (Spanish)

item.description:
There is a collection of books handwritten by the survivors of the first war against the demons where it’s narrated that under the island of Jiin there are two forged doors that enclose the infernal forces expelled by Arashi "the Exiled". A hero disowned by the false emperor, who has plunged the country into a punishing civil war facing a population that awaits the return of his hero to rid them of the tyranny of a mad throne and the rumors of demons returning to win back with blood what they once lost.

Yohei is born from the combination of the mysticism of Japanese folklore with a fantasy universe created for a wargame that faces asymmetrical clans in modular boards with numerous and different game modes. It combines mechanics such as dice rolling, grid movement, variable players powers, modular boards and card management to develop our strategy during the battle by acquiring warriors, invoking powerful event cards, legendary weapons and the construction of buildings that lead us to victory in exciting games of 60 to 90 minutes.

—description from the publisher

Existe una colección de libros manuscritos por los supervivientes de la primera guerra contra los demonios donde se asegura que bajo la isla de Jiin, dos puertas forjadas hace milenios contienen a las fuerzas infernales expulsadas por Arashi “el exiliado”. Un héroe repudiado por el falso emperador que ha sumido al país en una agotadora guerra civil enfrentando a una población que espera ansiosa el regreso de un héroe que los libere de la tiranía de un trono enloquecido y de los rumores de monstruos que acechan pacientes para reconquistar con sangre lo que una vez perdieron.

Yohei nace de la combinación del misticismo del folklore japonés con un universo de fantasía creado para ofrecer un wargame que enfrenta a clanes asimétricos en tableros modulares con numerosos modos de juego diferentes. Combina mecánicas como el dice rolling, grid movement, tropas asimétricas, tableros modulares y gestión de cartas para librar batallas mediante la adquisición de guerreros, construcción de edificios y la invocación de poderosos eventos y armas legendarias que conduzcan los jugadores a la victoria en apasionantes partidas de 60 a 90 minutos de duración.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

item.description:
11 Soccer is a funny micro game about soccer.
Become the new Neymar !!!!
It contains 17 cards. 
It's a Love Letter like.
You need to have deduction, memory and tactical skills to win the round
Every player has one card into his hand. At his turn, the player takes a new card and play one card. Action on this card is applied.

At the end, each player who still one card in his hand compare values. The winner of the round is the player with the most valuable card.

—description from the designer

The people of the Skylands live high above the earth in mystical floating islands. The grandiose cities on these islands are powered by magical energy from a rare crystal.

In the tile-laying game Skylands, you are tasked with building part of the Skylands kingdom. Go exploring for new areas of wood, stone, and most importantly, crystalline, as you seek to build the grandest part of the Kingdom.

On their turn, a player selects one of four actions: Explore, Harvest, Build, or Collect Energy. All players get to take the action, but the player who selected it gets an extra bonus. A player cannot select the same action two turns in a row. The actions allow players to select tiles and place them in their tableau, building out their landscape of Skylands, forest, and quarries. Completing these geographic features allows them to harvest resources, collect crystals, and build special buildings. The game continues until one player fills their tableau or all the tiles have been placed. Players receive points for their special buildings, materials, and points earned during the game, and the player with the most points wins.

Skylands includes special buildings for beginner, intermediate, and advanced play, as well as a campaign mode, and three small expansions ("Queenies") for more complexity.

item.description:
King of Football is a roll&write (PnP) football/soccer game for two players. Each of the nine rounds players roll 11 dice and alternating they pick one or two dice and write the value somewhere on their sheet in one of both colors (this information may remain hidden). Thus representing one of their team's players.

Then they determine which player has dominance in one part of the football field (wings or center) and can obtain the ball for a scoring chance. Each round there are possibly 3 scoring chances.

At the end of each round players switch pencil color and they erase the numbers in that same color (i.e. the numbers they wrote 2 rounds ago) before they repeat the process over again.

After 9 rounds (or 90 minutes) the score will determine the winner. But you can always play a rematch with special winner or loser powers.

—description from the designer

The player with the fly starts at the center of the web and tries to get to one of the 6 exit points to win the game. The other player starts with 5 spiders on 5 of the 6 exit points. The spiders win the game if they manage to force the fly back to the center space. Each player moves one space per turn.

The goal of the game is to occupy the enemy's stronghold (red or green square) At the beginning of the game, the pawns are placed on the small dots of their color. Movement is 1 space in any direction (straight or diagonal). Jumping over other pawns to an empty space behind them is also possible. Jumped over enemy pawns are eliminated from the game. The brown spaces may not be entered.
The doted spaces outside of the triangle around the stronghold are forts. Pawns in the fort may not be jumped over. If a player enters the enemy stronghold with a pawn, he wins the game.

A fast paced easy to play game that has basic and optional layers - The Psychological effect of warfare is very strongly reflected throughout the game and the rule mechanics. - Command and Control has effect in the basic and optional rules - National Characteristics and army lists - Napoleonic tactics are firmly rooted in the game - Players can use all the modern figure scales available e.g. 6mm, 10mm, 15mm and 28mm - Accommodates numerous figure to actual men ratios"

In the hybrid chess game POWER62, your objective is to capture the opponents' EPC (Eranium Processor Core ). Players/teams start out on opposing sides of the playing board placing their characters — EPC, PTX and BLACK HOLE pieces — in a pre-set order. From there they take turns trying to out-strategize their opponent to win the game.

Even if you play the same deck multiple times, the outcome will differ. "Luck of the Draw" on the move cards and power cards has a huge factor in whether your strategy works or crumbles.

—description from the publisher

Battle of the Bards is a dice-rolling card game with aspects of deck-building set in the fantasy world of Tessandor. Players create performances, recruit bards, and work with their roadies to capture audiences in a race to become the best bard troupe.

item.description:
While playing Extraordinary Voyages: Pirates', you become a pirate captain sailing three ships through the Caribbean in search of rich merchants to plunder and friendly ports in which to trade your booty for riches.

In more detail, you have one ship on each of the three "tracks", i.e., pathways through the Caribbean Sea. On each turn, you play three cards from your hand to move your ships. Your cards have a basic movement number, and often a secondary action. You may use one or the other to move your ships down the track or gain special advantages.

Each of the three tracks winds through the Caribbean islands toward your ultimate goal: the Spanish Treasure Galleon at Trinidad. Along the way, there will be detours that lead to merchant ships that may be plundered, and towns that may be visited to cash in your plunder for treasure. Plundering merchant ships and visiting towns also allows you to recruit more crewmen (cards) for your crew (deck). The better your deck is, the faster that your ships are able to move, so deciding when to take detours for plunder and recruiting and when to sail on toward your ultimate goal is an important decision that every pirate captain must make.

The first pirate captain to reach the Treasure Galleon at the end of any track ends the game. Each pirate ship scores points based on what place they finished on each track, as well as for the treasures earned by selling plunder. The richest captain goes down in history as the Pirate King!

Mary Engelbreit Loonacy is a rapid fire card game in which players race to be the first to empty their hand by matching one of two images on each card in their hand with the images on the face-up piles in front of them. The number of piles varies depending on the number of players, and if players ever reach a moment in which no one can play, everyone draws a card and adds it to their hand at the same time, then the game play resumes.

Fluxx is a card game in which the cards themselves determine the current rules of the game. By playing cards, you change numerous aspects of the game: how to draw cards, how to play cards, and even how to win.

At the start of the game, each player holds three cards and on a turn a player draws one card, then plays one card. By playing cards, you can put new rules into play that change numerous aspects of the game: how many cards to draw or play, how many cards you can hold in hand or keep on the table in front of you, and (most importantly) how to win the game. There are many editions, themed siblings, and promo cards available.

Fairy Tale Fluxx, illustrated by renowned folk artist Mary Engelbreit, brings the zaniness of "the card game of ever changing rules" to the land of "happily ever after", and the results are fit for a king! Gather Keepers to fit the current fairy tale Goal and you win — but look out for the Witch and the Wolf!

Rising for the Throne is a card game in which you control one of the six clans available to increase your army and win the battle.

Choose your clan and lead it to the throne.

Gryphonn - The power of politics.
Agnuth - Great in combat.
Valakiem - Full of magic.
Malüs - The richest house.
Ulferk - The most courageous clan.
Jörmund - The great explorers.

Throw the dices and gain resources for your clan, but don't be greed, you can lost it. Use that resources to recruit troops for your strategy and win Victory points. You can use your clan or cards ability for your advantage or use it to destroy your opponents. Take care of the game events, storms, floods, plagues... They could start in the middle of a game, some events would reduce your forces, but other events can help to protect your army. Once a player reach certain amount of Victory point the game ends, so watch your enemies and try to stop them for don't reach their objectives.

item.description:
There’s only one skydiving competition in which two teams race to form a five-man formation in the middle of free fall. After the starting jumpers make their leap, you have about fifteen minutes to be the first to complete your line and claim victory.

On your turn in Quinque, you mark a free skydiver on a tile (placing a parachute on their back) and move a tile with the four skydivers on it. You can also choose to move instead of marking, so you may move even two tiles in a turn. Players alternate turns until one of them successfully lines up five of their own skydivers horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. This five-man formation is called "Quinque"!

item.description: Six well-known Veronese figures make their appearance on the square day by day — but two of them are not the ones they appear to be. One of the players (the Nurse) disguised Romeo and Juliet in their clothes, their objective being to keep their secret safe from the other player (the Capulet).

item.description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION

 
 
 The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Donor Match is a non-authorized version of Spot it!.

 


Donor Match is a fast-paced medical/science themed object matching game.

Players use pattern matching to find the medical object common between two cards. Upon finding a match, they must scream the object name and then grab the card as quickly as possible before others find a match. This immediately reveals the next card and game play continues until there are no more cards left in the draw pile. The player with the most cards wins.

In one variation the player's objective is to discard their cards as quickly as possible upon finding a match. In this case, the first player to discard all their cards wins.

Included are 7 additional game play rule variations.

The hand-drawn realistic medical objects also provide players the opportunity to learn about the human body and medicine.

-description from designer

item.description:
In Papua, players lead a scientific expedition to Papua New Guinea, one of the richest territories in flora and fauna, in the late years of the XIXth century. Their discoveries will astonish the scientific community — but only if they run the expedition successfully. Whomever manages to collect the most relevant discoveries will be remembered throughout history.

In more detail, players have to manage their scientists and assign them to several tasks, from cultivating good relationships with the natives in order to get their help for the expedition to making sure that everyone gets fed at the end of the day! But most importantly, they work to gather the most amazing collection of new discoveries though secret bidding to amaze the world at large.

Players roll dice and allocate the results to the different areas of the board — huts, logistics, expeditions, funding, hunting and fishing, and field notebook — assigning their scientists to different tasks. Usually majorities determine which player wins each of these areas, which are where players can gather money to fund their expeditions, collect food to feed the crew, discover new scoring opportunities, or recruit more scientists. But the most important area is the expeditions zone, in which players can secretly bid for the discovery of new species of plants, animals or even native tribes. End of game scoring is based on the sets collected from the discovery zone, and the player with the highest prestige based on these sets wins the game.

—description from publisher

item.description:
The Imomushi silkworms can live only in the cold peaks of the Akaishi Mountains, and they produce the most delicate and expensive silk in the world. Very few people can withstand the hardships of the lonesome life a shepherd of giant silkworms leads. It is a solitary existence that requires great dedication and strength of character to bear the pressures that stem from competing with the few other shepherds who fight over the scarce but desirable feeding grounds, while keeping the fearsome ookamy at bay.

Silk is a gateway game into area control and worker placement systems. Players have to move their silkworms to the optimal spaces so they can feed on the best grass available, while pushing the other players' pieces into less desirable feeding grounds. In this game, players roll dice in order to determine which actions they are allowed to perform during their turn. There are six types of actions available: breeding more silkworms, moving the shepherd or their mastiff, building fences or farms, moving the ookami monster around the board, and — most importantly — getting your silkworms to feed. When silkworms feed, they generate a number of silk points, depending on the type of terrain they are standing on at that moment. These points can be used to modify the outcome of a dice roll, all while keeping in mind that the player with the most silk points at the end of the game wins!

—description from publisher

item.description:
Roam through the Queen’s Garden, the Fool’s Court, and the other groves of the greatest Renaissance Festival in the land. Be the first to visit the Taverns, Stages, Crafts, and other delights. Grab a Turkey Leg for an energy boost, purchase a Royal Pass to cut in line, or shop for the finest Souvenirs of your trip to the past. Claim the weekend’s best experiences and be crowned Ruler of RenFest!

Hex tiles build out a board of activities in seven types, such as Shoppes and Taverns. Each set of seven tiles forms a Grove, and the board contains one grove per player (3 to 6.) Parking spots line the edge of the groves, or a player can choose to save money by parking remotely and taking an extra turn to reach the activities.

Turns move quickly as the clock advances through the three nine-hour days of a long weekend at the RenFest. The starting player advances a clock dial piece one hour before each round.

The first player to reach each event has the option to claim the spot for the day. At the end of each day, the player with the most activities claimed in each grove scores points. Each player has only six Stamina per day, representing the energy needed to experience an activity. Stamina can also be used to run up to 3 steps to get ahead of other players.

At the end of the game, players score scaled points for collecting sets of the same activity type from multiple groves.

A limited supply of money must last the whole weekend. Shoppe tiles sell Souvenir cards with bonus points and special abilities. Food tiles allow purchase of extra Stamina for the day.

At the Royal Court space, players can buy Royal Pass cards that allow claiming an event that has already been claimed.

A player can choose to use their turn to leave early, making them starting player for the next day. Turn order is the final tie breaker.

—description from the designer

Medieval Realms is an economic euro game for 2 to 5 players.

Each player will asume the role of a medieval king. You will have to make your decisions to develope your own realm.

The game will be played during 8 to 12 rounds.

On each round players will have 2 different phases.

In the first phase, all players will secretly place their leaders (Mayors, generals and admirals) in the different spots on their player boards to earn resources (gold, production, materials, science, culture, religión and battle points)

In the second phase, players can take cards from the row using their resources. There are 10 different types of cards (Leaders, cities, markets, islands, territories, wars, castles, science, religion and culture)

There are 3 different cards mechanics. bidding, cards in hand and majority.

At the end of the game the player with the most victory points wins the game.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
A token take on tactical combat, Witches’ Sabbath is a 2 Player card-and-token skirmish game in which Players form a coven of three witches and one familiar to go head-to-head in the skirmish swamp- hurling brooms, spells, and unique abilities.

Master unique ability and cover systems based on the five major environmental elements of the swamp.

A roster of 15 witches and 10 Familiars to mix and match, along with a light play time, make for great replayability!

Features: 

 Easy-to-learn, hard-to-master system of location-based cover and abilities through the use of tokens
 Ingredient collection and spellcrafting
 Roster of 15 witches with their own unique appearance and abilities
 Compact, easy to set up design makes the game great on the go!




Mechanics: Action Point Allowance System, Take That, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Modular Board

—description from the designer

Es un juego de cartas, al estilo construye tu mazo, en donde cada equipo tiene por objetivo ganar un partido, para eso debe ir mejorando su mazo de juego entre cartas de habilidades y cartas estratégicas que le permitirán alterar distintas situaciones que se pueden dar.Cada equipo deberá ir eligiendo que cartas jugar de una mano de 6 cartas, hay algunas cartas que son habilidades que sirven para avanzar de forma directa sobre el terreno de juego y otras que son cartas tácticas que proporcionan una oportunidad de realizar combinaciones con las cartas de habilidad o bien modificar el juego del rival. 
Luego de que el marcador llegue al resultado pre pactado por los equipos, la próxima jugada que detenga el partido, da por concluido el encuentro. Quien haya obtenido más puntos será el ganador!

English description
It is a card game, style build your deck, where each team aims to win a game, so you must improve your game deck between skill cards and strategic cards that allow you to alter different situations that can occur.
Each team must choose which cards to play from a 6-card hand, there are some cards that are skills that are used to advance directly on the pitch and others that are tactical cards that provide an opportunity to make combinations with the cards of skill or modify the opponent's game
The game ends after a team reaches the score marked on the scoreboard and the game stops.

The players start with one pawn each at the edges of the game board. Movement is determined with a die. The first player to reach the center space wins the game.

The game was produced in Belgium.

The players start at the kitchen and try to reach the castle in the center of the game board. Movement is determined by a spinning top. On the spin of a 4, the player draws a heart and follows the instructions printed on it. On some spaces, events hinder or benefit the player. The first player at the castle wins the game.

The players use their betting tokens to bet on the results of all four teams (S=Sieg/win, N=Niederlage/loss, X=Unentschieden/draw).

Then the players move their footballs from space A to one of the three destination spaces (S, N, X). Movement is determined by a die. On the roll of a 6 between space A and the black space, the ball has to go back to space A. If the 6 is rolled after the black space or if the ball reaches space B, it goes back to the black space.

When all 4 teams have reached a destination space, the winnings are determined according to the occupied destination space of each team and the submitted bets of the players.

link.value: Esslinger Verlag J. F. Schreiber GmbH

item.description: Each player plays an alien race trying to escape the explosion of a nearby sun by moving their three artificial planets (orbs) out of the blast radius. Players build bridges and gates on the gameboard to bring their orbs outward into ever more distant orbits around the exploding center of their solar system.

Bragging Rights is a game of competitive bullshitting. Everyone plays as the world's incompetent criminal underbelly, all trying to gain street cred for a crime none of you committed.

Players can play as a set character with traits or a new one made up on the spot. The players draw evidence cards, create a play pile for the game and keep a hand of three pieces of evidence they can swap in. Every game has one specific crime, from stealing the Mona Lisa from the Louvre, to Replacing church bells with maracas.

Each round a piece of evidence is turned over and every player has to construct a unique story of how they left that at the crime scene. As the rounds go on more evidence must be woven into your stories trying to keep them as consistent as possible. But watch out, if you mess up and your story stops making sense other players can wager their street cred to call you out on it. You’ll need to convince everyone at the table that you’re making sense to not lose face (and points).

At the end of the game a Story Winner is chosen and players count up their street cred. Whoever has the most cred earns bragging rights for this crime.

-description from designer

name.value: Bionicle: Toa Nuva Reconstruct Starter Box

item.description:
A Bionicle Trading card game!

The first person to build their Bionicle wins! By building one piece per turn or taking away pieces from your opponent. Use the card set and paper playmat that comes with it or use your real Bionicle!

When the Toa are exposed to the strange energies of protodermis, they are transformed into the mighty Toa Nuva. Although they seek to use their newfound powers, the Toa Nuva are no match for the elemental fury of gigantic wind funnels. The funnels strike the Toa Nuva tearing them apart and scattering their pieces all over the landscape. It is your job to recontruct the Toa Nuva or Mata Nui will be defenseless against Makuta's evil.

Rainbow Rabbits is a collaborative, fast-paced 2-6 player card game. The concept is simple: build rainbows together and be the first to run out of your cards. There is no turn taking, so you need to be quick like a bunny if you want to win. You're going to love it!

Feeling skeptical? Fact: even the most cynical player will yell “Red! Orange! Yellow..GOLD!” by the end of the the first round.

No matter the flavor of play you choose, the basic Rainbow Rabbits game remains the same: build rainbows together and be the first to run out of your cards. There is no turn taking, so you better be quick like a bunny if you want to win.


 On “Go” everyone starts flipping through their cards. You can only ever play the top card from your hand. 
 When a player flips over a RED card, they can start a rainbow in the middle of the play area. 
 There can only be 3 rainbows in the play area at one time. So if a player flips over a RED card, but there are already 3 rainbows in play, they need to keep flipping.
 Once a RED card is played, any player can add to the rainbow in sequential order: RED, ORANGE, YELLOW, GREEN, BLUE, INDIGO, VIOLET, GOLD.
 If 2 or more players try and play a card at the same time, the player whose card is on the bottom remains, and the other players must return their card to their hands.
 The player who places the GOLD card on a rainbow needs to sweep that rainbow out of the play area to make room for a new rainbow. 
 When a player has flipped through all of the cards in their hand, they can pick up their pile and start all over again. 
 When a player has played all of the cards in their hand, the round is over. 


—description from the designer

Robot Royale is a tile-based strategic combat game for 2-4 players. Players aim to claim victory through moving and positioning their robots and rotating tiles to trap and destroy their opponents, scoring points each time they do.

Robot Royale has core mechanics that are easy to learn and quick to play, but is also robust enough to have tactical depth and encourage competitive play. The game has a very high replay value due to the interchangeable tile layouts and the choices made during play.

In Robot Royale, each player controls a robot who is seeking to hunt down opposing robots and destroy them, claiming victory. This is achieved simply by drawing line of sight to an opposing robot during their turn. The arena however is designed to make this difficult, 16 square tiles each comprised of four spaces with walls and falling floors restricting the robots' movement.

Players move their robot in straight lines and rotate tiles to change the layout of the arena to their advantage, creating routes to allow them to destroy another robot or limiting an opponent’s possible moves and trapping them. Another feature of the arena is that once a robot leaves a space it falls away leaving a space that cannot be occupied. As the game progresses these spaces reduce the robots’ possible moves, forcing them together into a final showdown.

A game of Robot Royale is won when a player reaches their goal, three points in an average game.

—description from the publisher

The theater in your small town is having a hard time getting people to come in to see its plays. They need your help coming up with ideas for plays that will bring lots of customers in. There’s a catch, though! They have a very limited budget, so you’ll need to work with the sets, characters, and props that the theater already has. And you'll also have to deal with the directors - some of them have their own agenda. Come in and pitch your story – be creative and you’ll win the prize role of Chief Theater Writer among your competitors!

Center Stage is a storytelling card-based game. Players take cards from each of three decks: sets, props, and characters. They must then develop a quick story including each of these random elements. One player each round serves as the director. He/She takes a card indicating a direction or goal for the winning story - that only the director knows. Players tell their stories, and the director chooses the best one. The winning storyteller receives $1, which may be used as a victory point, or to choose a different card when telling a story. The first player to 5 points wins.

—description from the publisher

CONTEXT

A massive combat ship that emerged from an open portal to another dimension is trying to invade planet earth. The earth’s defensive shield was activated, but it is only strong enough to withstand the enemy’s main laser for a short period of time.

Our only hope rest on a small fleet of terrestrial spaceships that were orbiting the earth, ill prepared for such a moment of crisis. These ships’ crew now holds the most important mission of their lives: attempt to destroy the enemy ship while simultaneously keeping the earth’s shield functioning, in an effort to avoid the end of all humankind.

MECHANICS

During the match, the players must prepare the crew (roll dice) and take them to perform various tasks on the ships (modules). After all player ships have participated, the enemy turn will begin, during which the enemies will attempt different actions against the player ships or planet earth depending on the Strategy Card that has been revealed.

After each round, the state of the game must be checked to determine whether the match has ended, be it in favor or against the players. If the match has not yet ended, another round is prepared, advancing the marker on the portal to another dimension to the next counter, among other things. The game will inevitably end when the marker on the portal to another dimension reaches the last counter and cannot be moved any forward at the end of the round.

The players must use the limited amount of turns at their disposal to try and prepare their ships and improve them as much as possible, with better modules and more crew, in order to be victorious. Achieving good synergy between the modules of a ship and maintaining good communication with companions might result in a seemingly impossible task being successfully completed.

The earth is counting on you! Good luck!

item.description: The game simulates the battle of Maipú which marked the end of Spanish colonial rule of Chile. Each player picks an officer card at the beginning of the game which has certain unique characteristics, like a fighting bonus in certain types of battle. They command different units with numerical values for attack, damage, movement, range, defense and resistance. Battles are decided by rolling 2d6.

The Battle of Párkány (Turkish: Cigerdelen Savasi) (October 7–9, 1683) was a battle fought in the town of Párkány (today: Štúrovo), in the Ottoman Empire, and the area surrounding it as part of the Polish-Ottoman War and the Great Turkish War.

The battle was fought in two stages. In the first stage Polish troops under John III Sobieski were defeated by the Ottoman army under Kara Mehmed Pasha on October 7, 1683.

In the second stage Sobieski, supported by Austrian forces under Charles V, Duke of Lorraine, defeated the Ottoman forces, which were supported by the troops of Imre Thököly, and gained control of Párkány on October 9, 1683.

After the defeat Austrians would besiege Esztergom and captured it at the end of 1683.

Game uses Husaria system, designed for XVII century battles.

The 7th Armored Division was an armored division of the British Army that saw distinguished active service during World War II, where its exploits in the Western Desert Campaign gained it the Desert Rats nickname. This exciting new wargame centers on the battles of this distinguished division.

The Italian attack on Egypt in 1940 opened the new front of World War II. Over the next three years, north Africa's deserts became a place of many fiece battles. Joining the action by the German troops provided the Axis some momentary success. But the Allies weren't willing to give up an inititive and lead further counterattacks.

Game contains the following scenarios: Compas I, II, Rommel's Attack, "Brevity", "Battleaxe", "Crusader", and Gazala.

[Overview]
Rock Paper Monsters is a turn-based card game that follows the core mechanics of Rock Paper Scissors, with an added element of scoring points based off of the card value. Every card has a cartoon illustrated monster, with some having trigger abilities that occur at various points in the game.

Players take turns playing Monster or Bonus cards to both destroy opponent’s cards and score the most points. Each Monster type has a strength and weakness against another type. Bonus cards can be played instead of a Monster card, providing unique advantages. The player with the highest score after all cards are played wins a Monster Bite. Cards are then reshuffled and the next round begins. The first player to 10 Monster Bites wins.

[Gameplay]
Beginning Phase:
Each player draws 6 cards. Then, each player takes 3 cards off the Draw pile and places then face down in a row across from each other. When ready, flip over each card and determine the winning Monster. Monster cards battle directly across from each other.

Play Phase:
At the start of a player’s turn, they may choose to discard 1 card in hand and draw 1 card from the Draw pile.

Next, the player plays 1 card immediately to the left or to the right of one of their cards in play. If they have no cards in play, they must play a card across from one of their opponent’s cards. When playing a Monster Card, if their opponent has a Monster Card directly across from their Monster Card, they begin the [Battle]. When playing a Bonus Card, no battle occurs.

This completes their turn and it is now their opponent’s turn to play. Continue alternating turns until all cards in hand are played.

Easy memory game originally designed for the Piecepack. It can also be played with other materials, such as standard playing cards.

24 tiles of cards, bearing the numbers 1 to 6 in 4 suits, are displayed on the table in a well-defined matrix. In each turn, a player uncover two of them - if they match suit, the player can secretly choose one of them and keep it (unless they already have a tile/card with the same number). The other tile will be placed on any free position in the matrix. The first player to have 6 tiles/cards, each with one number, wins the game.

—description from the publisher

link.value: 新ボードゲーム党 (New Board Game Party)

item.description:
Entrejuegos is a game made to promote a board game store in Santiago.

It's a 2 player game, in the vein of Blink were you try to play all your cards as fast as you can. However, there are two main differences: 

 Speed is important, but most important is observation, because if, at any time a player plays a card that make an "Entrejuegos" you can call it and stop the game. An "Entrejuegos" (translation: "between-games") is a set of three cards, the first one of a type, the second of a different type, and the third must be the same as the first. So, for example, the last three cards are a Wargame, a Party Game and again a Wargame, you can call it.
 The second difference is that the game has some scoring: 4 points for being the first one to throw all your cards, and 1 point for each Entrejuegos set.




—description from the designer

Stratoyager is inspired by many SF universes, but if we were to point out the most important ones, those would be Wing Commander, Star Lancer, Battlestar Galactica, Space Above and Beyond, Babylon 5, Starship Troopers and, last but not least, Aliens.

We tried to recreate space flight „physics” known from Wing Commander game and Battlestar Galactica TV show, where fighters in space don’t act as WWII planes over Pacific, but can actually perform maneuvers available in space, like moving sideways, spinning, or fly on reverse thrust.

Movement is based on vector principle, and we tried our best to make it as easy to grasp as possible, to deliver maximum fun with minimum bookkeeping. We are fully aware that those rules are anywhere near actual physics, but we think it is the best compromise between gaming experience and feel of in-universe reality. You will judge it on your own.

Goal of the game is to disable and destroy opponent's Yager forces, but may vary with different missions. Game is played using miniatures, counters, cards and dice. Each craft has a specific maneuver and offensive capability. Turn is divided into 
1. Initiative, 
2. Maneuver Action, 
3. Hull Stress, 
4. Combat Actions, 
5. Combat Resolution, 
6. Damage, 
7. Locked Missile Damage.

—description from the publisher

name.value: The Deck of Justice: A card game on steroids

item.description:
The Deck of Justice is a ridiculously frantic, yet highly tactical, hand-drawn card game for 2-5 players. Players take turns striking one another (with fully loaded heroes, armored vehicles and bulging biceps) in a series of quick cowboy standoffs until there is only one survivor.

It is basically a parody of all the (weird) stuff we love about Japanese cartoon...with a Tarantino-ish homage style to the 70s (and 80s)...encapsulated in an outrageously fast-paced & novel (with a touch of retro) game mechanics. The game takes less than 2-minutes to learn and each round takes 15-30 minutes to play.

The deck is on sale now:
https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/deck-of-justice

—description from the publisher

Pirates is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!
—description from the publisher (translated)

Votre capitaine vous a confié une mission importante : veiller sur un homme au pouvoir inestimable, mais dont vous ignorez le secret. Or, voilà que le prisonnier échappe à votre vigilance et disparaît déjà vers une île mystérieuse. En fidèle pirate, vous sautez du bateau pour nager en eaux troubles, prêt à franchir une jungle inhospitalière, à gravir des montagnes infranchissables, à traverser des marais puants et des villages de brigands ! Mais serez-vous toujours un loyal corsaire quand vous découvrirez le secret de cet homme ?

Votre aventure dépendra de vos choix, car le héros, c’est vous !

—description from the publisher

name.value: The War of the Worlds: Invasion
La Guerra de los Mundos: Invasión

item.description:
The War of the Worlds: Invasion is an asymmetrical war game for 2 players, based on the classic sci-fi novel by H.G. Wells.

One of you will control the British Empire and will have to defend Earth using wits, diplomacy and the force of arms. The British player can build laboratories and barracks, move armies across different countries, ask for the help of politicians and military leaders and even call the mighty Thunderchild!

The other player will control the cruel Martians. The main resource with which he counts is human blood. Therefore, he will have at his disposal a sinister blood farm to supply his armies. He can also raise the Red Weed and build tripods, handling machines or flying machines in order to complete the conquest of Earth.

Of course, when the humans and the aliens meet in a country, there will be a battle. Battles are played in a fast and tactical way. Each troop has a different combat value, based on its speed and its fire power. When an army recieves damage, the general can distribute it between their men... but, beware! A destroyed unit can't retaliate!

The British will rely in their courage and bigger numbers. If everything fails, they can retreat to a safer place. The Martians can use the heat-ray, the black smoke and fear in order to win the combat.

The British have three ways of winning:


 Unite all nations of the Earth via diplomatic action.
 Destroy every single martian unit.
 Resist until the bacteria kill the invaders.


The Martians have also three ways of winning:


 Scare all nations of the Earth.
 Conquer seven regions of the world map.
 Conquer and secure three regions of the world map.


—description from the publisher

You have successfully completed your first mission and now know where your fugitive prisoner is hiding. But capturing it looks much harder! You will have to search a fortified city full of traps, interrogate locals who are not very loquacious and particularly inhospitable, look for clues to solve the mysteries that hover over the fugitive ... Riddles, quests and challenges will be the watchwords of your second Pirates adventure. !

Your adventure will depend on your choices, because the hero is you!

Pirates 2 is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Vous avez réussi votre première mission et savez maintenant où se cache votre prisonnier en fuite. Mais le capturer s’annonce autrement plus difficile ! Vous devrez fouiller une ville fortifiée truffée de pièges, interroger des habitants peu loquaces et particulièrement inhospitaliers, chercher des indices pour résoudre les mystères qui planent au-dessus du fugitif… Enigmes, quêtes et défis seront les maîtres-mot de votre seconde aventure de Pirates !

Votre aventure dépendra de vos choix, car le héros, c’est vous !
—description from the publisher
